summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys and other personnel in the Southern District of New York, discussing the transmission of FBI 302 interview reports and notes, and planning an approach to an individual (name redacted) in Hoboken. It reveals coordination within the prosecution team during the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email discussing the need for 302s and notes, and inquiring about plans to approach an individual in Hoboken.

events.title: Email coordination regarding 302s and approach
events.description: Email exchange among prosecutors discussing the sending of FBI 302 interview reports and notes, and planning an approach to an individual in Hoboken.

events.title: 302s and notes sent in zip file
events.description: An individual reported sending FBI 302 interview reports and notes in a zip file to the team.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively coordinating the receipt of FBI 302 interview reports and related notes in April 2019.
The team was planning to approach an individual in Hoboken, with the approach date being a topic of discussion.
The email chain indicates potential server issues with receiving the 302s, prompting a resend request.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative steps and evidence gathering by the prosecution team.
